summary: The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act changed many aspects of the private health insurance markets, including establishing health insurance exchanges in each state beginning in 2014—intended to allow consumers to compare and select health plans. In this testimony, we discuss our prior work that found: enrollment in health plans was concentrated among a small number of health insurance issuers ; consumers in the individual...
title: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act: Concentration, Plan Availability and Premiums, and Enrollee Experiences in Health Insurance Markets Since 2014
